result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendrick L Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Branch 1 not in session on November 14, 2022. Clerk contacted and advised parties that Court will not be in session on November 14, 2022 and rescheduled the pretrial conference to November 18, 2022 at 8:30am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Kendrick L Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Kendrick L Mitchell.  ttorney Patrick T. Franken appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.S. & the Planet Fitness at 101 W. Wisconsin Avenue.
